Nerangs.ab: apascā vā̊ azīšcā vā̊ mātərąšcā vā̊ agəńiiā̊ drigudāiiaŋhō vīspō.paitīš auuaōcāmā vahištā̊ sraēštā̊ auuā və̄ vaŋᵛhīš rātōiš darəgō.bāzāuš zōhr čahār angust az ǰīwām ul dārišn zōhr andak-ē andar āb kunišn nāšū paitī zōhr abar āb nihišn viiādā̊ paitī abar barsom sə̄ṇdā̊ abar āb mātarō abar barsom jītaiiō abar āb yeŋ́hē hātąm āat̰ yesnē paitī tā gyāg guftan zōhr abar barsom nihādan

"apascā vā̊ azīšcā vā̊ mātərąšcā vā̊ agəńiiā̊ drigudāiiaŋhō vīspō.paitīš auuaōcāmā vahištā̊ sraēštā̊ auuā və̄ vaŋᵛhīš rātōiš darəgō.bāzāuš. He has to hold the zōhr four angust from the ǰīwām and to pour one drop of zōhr into the water. At nāšū paitī, he has to put the zohr over the water. At viiādā̊ paitī, over the barsom. At sə̄ṇdā̊, over the water. At mātarō, over the barsom. At jītaiiō, over the water. The should recite yeŋ́hē hātąm āat̰ yesnē paitī until the end and put the zōhr over the barsom."

At' nāšū paitī, he has to put the zōhr over the water. At viiādā̊, over the barsom. At paitī, over the water. At sə̄ṇdā̊, over the barsom. At mātarō jītaiiō, over the water. At yeŋ́hē hātąm, over the barsom and they should recite until the end."

Quotations.ab: u-š ābestāg pad barsom bē gōwišn u-š be šawišn u-š pēmišn pad āb bē kunišn u-š abāz āyišn u-š ān ī pad barsom bē kunišn apō ... viiādā̊ ... mātarō jītaiiō abar āb ud abārīg abar barsom pad rātōiš zōhrag andak-ē andar ō āb rēzišn zōhrag čahār angust az āb ul dārišn barsom čahār angust az zōhr ul dārišn az ān gyāg paydāg auuauuat̰ taδa ẏaθa caθβarō ərəzuuō pad hamāg abestāg

"He has to recite the abastāg for the barsom, to go and to make the milk-offering for the waters. He has to come back and make to it for the barsom. At apō ... viiādā̊ ... mātarō jītaiiō, (he has to make the offering) for the water and (to offer) the rest to the barsom. At rātōiš, he has to pour a little zōhrag into the water. He has to hold the zōhrag four fingers above the water and the barsom four fingers above the zōhr, (this) is evident from this passage: auuauuat̰ taδa ẏaθa caθβarō ərəzuuō, (which is found) throughout the Avesta."

apō ... viiā̊dā̊ ... mātarō jītaiiō abar āb ud abārīg [abar] barsom pad rātōiš zōhrag andak-ē andar ō āb rēzišn zōhrag 4 angust az āb ul dārišn barsom 4 angušt az zōhr ul dārišn az ān gyāg paydāg auuauuat̰ taδa ẏaθa caθβarō ərəzuu pad hamāg abestāg

At apō ... viiā̊dā̊ ... mātarō jītaiiō (he has to make the offering)on the water and the rest on the barsom. At rātōiš, he has to pour a little of zōhrag on the water. He has to hold the zōhrag four fingers away from the water; the barsom four fingers from zōhr. This is revealed in this passage: auuauuat̰ taδa ẏaθa caθβarō ərəzuuō("as much as four fingers") , everywhere in the abastāg.
